Wrapper for Webview.

Types

Webview = pointer
  Source   Edit 
WebviewHint = enum
  HintNone,                 ## Width and height are default size
  HintMin,                  ## Width and height are minimum bounds
  HintMax,                  ## Width and height are maximum bounds
  HintFixed                  ## Window size can not be changed by a user
Enum version of WEBVIEW_HINT consts.   Source   Edit 
WebviewVersion {.bycopy.} = object
  major*, minor*, patch*: cuint
  Source   Edit 
WebviewVersionInfo {.bycopy.} = object
  version*: WebviewVersion
  versionNumber*: array[32, char]
  preRelease*: array[48, char]
  buildMetadata*: array[48, char]

Procs

proc bindCallback(w: Webview; name: string;
                  fn: proc (seq: string; req: JsonNode): string) {....raises: [],
    tags: [RootEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
Essentially a high-level version of webviewBind   Source   Edit 
proc create(debug: cint | bool = isDebug; window: pointer = nil): Webview {.
    cdecl, importc: "webview_create", ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates a new webview instance. If debug is non-zero - developer tools will be enabled (if the platform supports them). Window parameter can be a pointer to the native window handle. If it's non-null - then child WebView is embedded into the given parent window. Otherwise a new window is created. Depending on the platform, a GtkWindow, NSWindow or HWND pointer can be passed here. Returns null on failure. Creation can fail for various reasons such as when required runtime dependencies are missing or when window creation fails.   Source   Edit 
proc destroy(w: Webview) {.cdecl, importc: "webview_destroy", ...raises: [],
                           tags: [].}
Destroys a webview and closes the native window.   Source   Edit 
proc dispatch(w: Webview; fn: proc (w: Webview; arg: pointer) {.cdecl.};
              arg: pointer = nil) {.cdecl, importc: "webview_dispatch",
                                    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Posts a function to be executed on the main thread. You normally do not need to call this function, unless you want to tweak the native window.   Source   Edit 
proc eval(w: Webview; js: cstring) {.cdecl, importc: "webview_eval", ...raises: [],
                                     tags: [].}
Evaluates arbitrary JavaScript code. Evaluation happens asynchronously, also the result of the expression is ignored. Use RPC bindings if you want to receive notifications about the results of the evaluation.   Source   Edit 
proc getWindow(w: Webview): pointer {.cdecl, importc: "webview_get_window",
                                      ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns a native window handle pointer. When using GTK backend the pointer is GtkWindow pointer, when using Cocoa backend the pointer is NSWindow pointer, when using Win32 backend the pointer is HWND pointer.   Source   Edit 
proc html=(w: Webview; html: string) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Setter alias for setHtml().

Example:

let w = create()

w.html = "<h1>Hello</h1>"
  Source   Edit 
proc init(w: Webview; js: cstring) {.cdecl, importc: "webview_init", ...raises: [],
                                     tags: [].}
Injects JavaScript code at the initialization of the new page. Every time the webview will open a the new page - this initialization code will be executed. It is guaranteed that code is executed before window.onload.   Source   Edit 
proc navigate(w: Webview; url: cstring) {.cdecl, importc: "webview_navigate",
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Navigates webview to the given URL. URL may be a properly encoded data URI.

Example:

let w = create()

w.navigate("https://github.com/webview/webview")
w.navigate("data:text/html,%3Ch1%3EHello%3C%2Fh1%3E")
w.navigate("data:text/html;base64,PGgxPkhlbGxvPC9oMT4=")
  Source   Edit 
proc newWebview(debug: bool = isDebug; window: pointer = nil): Webview {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Alias of create()   Source   Edit 
proc run(w: Webview) {.cdecl, importc: "webview_run", ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Runs the main loop until it's terminated. After this function exits - you must destroy the webview.   Source   Edit 
proc setHtml(w: Webview; html: cstring) {.cdecl, importc: "webview_set_html",
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Set webview HTML directly.

Example:

let w = create()

w.setHtml("<h1>Hello</h1>")
  Source   Edit

             hints: cint = WEBVIEW_HINT_NONE) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webview_set_size", ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Updates native window size. See WEBVIEW_HINT constants.   Source   Edit

proc setTitle(w: Webview; title: cstring) {.cdecl, importc: "webview_set_title",
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Updates the title of the native window. Must be called from the UI thread.   Source   Edit 
proc size=(w: Webview; size: tuple[width: int, height: int]) {....raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Setter alias for setSize(). hints default to WEBVIEW_HINT_NONE.   Source   Edit 
proc terminate(w: Webview) {.cdecl, importc: "webview_terminate", ...raises: [],
                             tags: [].}
Stops the main loop. It is safe to call this function from another other background thread.   Source   Edit 
proc title=(w: Webview; title: string) {....raises: [], tags: [].}

proc unbind(w: Webview; name: cstring) {.cdecl, importc: "webview_unbind",
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Removes a callback that was previously set by bindCallback().   Source   Edit 
proc version(): WebviewVersionInfo {....raises: [], tags: [].}

Dereferenced of webviewVersion().

Same as webviewVersion()[].

  Source   Edit 
proc webviewBind(w: Webview; name: cstring;
                 fn: proc (seq: cstring; req: cstring; arg: pointer) {.cdecl.};
                 arg: pointer = nil) {.cdecl, importc: "webview_bind",
                                       ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Binds a callback so that it will appear under the given name as a global JavaScript function. Internally it uses init(). Callback receives a request string and a user-provided argument pointer. Request string is a JSON array of all the arguments passed to the JavaScript function.   Source   Edit 
proc webviewReturn(w: Webview; seq: cstring; status: cint; result: cstring) {.
    cdecl, importc: "webview_return", ...raises: [], tags: [].}

Allows to return a value from the native binding. Original request pointer must be provided to help internal RPC engine match requests with responses.

If status is zero - result is expected to be a valid JSON result value.

If status is not zero - result is an error JSON object.

  Source   Edit 
proc webviewVersion(): ptr WebviewVersionInfo {.cdecl,
    importc: "webview_version", ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Get the library's version information.   Source   Edit
